transcript_chunks.text: if you somehow miss severance on apple tv plus you need to watch it season one just wrapped up a couple of weeks ago and its nine episodes took me on a journey that i didn't want to see end the show follows adam scott as mark who has undergone a procedure called severance severance basically splits you into two separate people there's the you that shows up to your office at work and performs your day job and then there's the you that leaves work and lives the rest of your life the thing about severance is that your work self is trapped working in an office for their entire existence whether they like it or not yeah it's up the dope thing about the show is how it builds on this premise layering and rules for how severance works conspiracy about what goes on at lumen the company the mark works for and highlighting weird idiosyncrasies regarding office life there's a mysterious board that runs everything a break room that is scarier than it sounds and a ceo who is treated like a religious

for and highlighting weird idiosyncrasies regarding office life there's a mysterious board that runs everything a break room that is scarier than it sounds and a ceo who is treated like a religious figure the performances are great especially from adam scott trimmel tillman and brit lauer and the build up toward the thrilling reveals is top tier it is one of the most engaging first seasons of a show that i've seen in a very long time that is why
